intro: Onosma mirabilis, commonly known as the Persian glory flower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
